recommendations: Chaine Leaps is a series of jumps in which the skater alternates between the front and back legs.. For practicing Chaine Leaps as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Chaine turns, Skips, Leap preparations for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Perform a chaine turn., Push off the back leg, leaping forward., Land on the front leg, bending knees., Repeat with the opposite leg. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Fish Roll and Flop is a movement where the dancer rolls their body in a fluid motion resembling the movement of a fish, while the Flop is a contemporary dance move where the dancer falls to the ground in a sudden and dramatic manner.. For practicing Fish Roll and Flop as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Cross-body shoulder stretch: Sit or stand with your feet hip-width apart. Reach one arm across your body, using your other arm to gently pull it towards your chest. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Thread the needle stretch: Begin on your hands and knees, then thread one arm through the space between your opposite arm and knee. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Reverse table-top pose: Sit on the ground with your hands behind you and your feet on the ground. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a table-top shape with your body. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then release. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and engage your core muscles for stability., Lift right shoulder up and back., Simultaneously lift left shoulder up and forward., Move right shoulder down and forward., Move left shoulder down and back, alternating continuously. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.

Jazz Contraction is a contraction of the muscles in the back of the legs, which is used to create a higher jump.. For practicing Jazz Contraction as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Pelvic tilts, Cat-cow stretch, Seated forward bend for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart., Bend knees slightly., Curve spine forward, contracting core., Drop head down, keeping neck aligned., Slowly return to starting position. for 3 repetitions for 5 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on artistry, additional exercises could include Flowing port de bras, Dance to different music, Free movement improvisation.
